alert.note: Alert for Johnston (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 03 at 6:59PM EST until January 05 at 2:18PM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Carolina... Neuse River Near Clayton affecting Johnston County. Neuse River At Smithfield affecting Johnston County. For the Neuse River...including Clayton, Smithfield...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Neuse River Near Clayton. * WHEN...Until early Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Minor flooding begins. Minor overflow occurs on both banks. Water reaches the edge of the Neuse River Greenway trail. At 10.0 feet, The Neuse River Greenway at Covered Bridge Road begins to flood. At 13.0 feet, Flooding will close the Neuse River Greenway trail. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 PM EST Monday the stage was 9.8 feet. - Forecast...The river will to 11.2 feet tomorrow morning. It will fall below flood stage early Wednesday morning to 2.2 feet and then begin rising Friday evening then rise again. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Fri Neuse River Clayton 9.0 9.8 Mon 6 pm ES 10.5 5.5 2.8 2.2 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rah/rivers. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning by 700 AM EST.
